column4: hi all, have trouble getting my wlan adapter to work (centrino)
can't send a ping over wlan although it tells me i'm connected
anyone an idea?
ifconfig tells me it's up and connected, already has an address, but still i can't ping /surf
destination host unreachable
nobody?
no, already tried without, same prob
could you paste 'ifconfig -a' and 'netstat -r'
to http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/ ;)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14934
could you do 'netstat -r' too?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14936
which of those two NICs do you want to access the net through btw?
at the moment to be able to ssh and paste the text in the box, i use the lan-nic.
but i want to be able to use both
they're both connected to the same network though? you'll need to setup the routing table
yes, they're both connected to the same net. what i'd like to do is being able to use the "places"-function under gnome-network - settings: switch between home-lan / home-wlan
that should be relatively easy, just don't have both interfaces up at the same time
for home-lan disable eth1, and from home-wan disable eth0
thanks, tried that b4, didn't work, now it miracolusly works. Great, Thanks!
np's :)
